news.title: Heartbroken family of Fermanagh shooting victims assured they are not alone as country ‘shocked to its core’
news.summary: The heartbroken family of Vanessa Whyte (45) and her two children, James (14) and Sara (13), who died in a triple murder-suicide in Fermanagh, have been assured they were not alone in facing the appalling tragedy.

news.title: Tsunami waves reach Hawaii and head for US west coast after major 8.8 earthquake strikes Russia
news.summary: A powerful magnitude 8.8 earthquake off Russia's Far Eastern Kamchatka Peninsula triggered tsunami waves of up to 5 metres (16 feet) and sparked evacuation orders in Hawaii and across the Pacific on Wednesday.

news.title: Arrest made after man dies and woman in serious condition following M50 crash
news.summary: A man has been arrested following a fatal road crash on the M50 in the early hours of this morning.

news.title: Patrick Kielty and Cat Deeley were the epitome of TV power couples before shock separation
news.summary: News that  Late Late Show  host Patrick Kielty (54) has split from his TV star wife Cat Deeley (48) has come as a shock for many.

news.title: Tánaiste signs joint statement with 14 foreign ministers calling for ‘unhindered humanitarian access’ in Gaza
news.summary: Tánaiste Simon Harris has signed a joint statement with foreign ministers of 14 other countries urging “unhindered humanitarian access” in the Gaza Strip as famine grips the besieged enclave.

news.title: Brian O’Driscoll interview: ‘I was crying on the inside but tried not to throw my toys out of the cot’
news.summary: “I avoided going on the piss on the Sunday with all the other lads,” recalls Brian O’Driscoll. “I knew if I went on the piss, I wouldn’t be right until Thursday.

news.title: Row erupts over claim in government report there are ‘not enough builders’ for major infrastructure projects
news.summary: A row has erupted over a government report warning that major state projects are at risk of not being completed due to capacity constraints in the construction sector.

news.title: Why have I developed a crush on a blue cartoon dog?
news.summary: In recent years, I have had an ongoing crush. The crush in question is married. He is emotionally sensitive, considerate, family oriented. He has a dry sense of humour, endless patience and a stable job working as an archaeologist.

news.title: ‘We sold all sorts. There was a bucket full of dentures and people would come in and try them on’
news.summary: Selling skeletons and dentures may sound like something from a horror film, but for Christy Bird’s in Dublin’s Portobello, it was once their bread and butter.

news.title: Paul Williams: The five biggest challenges that face our new €314,000 Garda Commissioner Justin Kelly
news.summary: The incoming garda commissioner Justin Kelly is taking the reins of the organisation at a time when the demands placed on it by a rapidly changing, complex society are at the highest they have ever been.
